text: this was the moment history was made in
the state of South Carolina the governor
signing a bill to remove the Confederate
battle flag from the grounds of the
State House the flag has been flying
here since the early 1960s for African
Americans a symbol of slavery
segregation and subordination mr.
Alexander I strallan I it took thirteen
hours of debate before South Carolina's
politicians finally voted in favor of
removing the flag for many white
Americans
it's an emblem of their heritage of the
Civil War which began in this state more
than 150 years ago but in recent weeks
attitudes have changed dramatically we
do something such as take such
passionate pleas for change prompted by
the murder of nine African Americans
inside a church in this state last month
the man accused of the shooting Dylan
roof had earlier posted these
photographs of himself with the flag so
this afternoon the controversial flag
will disappear from the Statehouse a
move unthinkable just a few weeks ago
would you go up in BBC News
